thread.title: 'I will mumble this only once': BBC's new Nazi drama SS-GB hit by dialogue complaints | Television & radio | The Guardian
thread.title_full: 'I will mumble this only once': BBC's new Nazi drama SS-GB hit by dialogue complaints | Television & radio | The Guardian

author: Matthew Weaver
title: 'I will mumble this only once': BBC's new Nazi drama SS-GB hit by dialogue complaints | Television & radio | The Guardian
text:
The drama includes several subtitled sections involving German actors speaking in their native tongue. Many viewers took to Twitter to say it was the English-speaking sections where subtitles were needed. Paula Nolan (@PaulaStrand) #ssgb Subtitle department should have kept it up for all the dialogue. Head melted trying to understand this. 
Others expressed incredulity that the corporation appears to have failed to learn lessons after the mumbling row that overshadowed the adaptation of Jamaica Inn in 2014 when viewing figures plummeted after hundreds of complaints about inaudible dialogue . 
The BBC’s current Saturday night drama Taboo – Tom Hardy’s tale about the East India Company and the slave trade – has enjoyed better reviews, but has also been beset by viewers’ complaints about mumbling actors. Victoria Isherwood (@VicIsherwood) FFS, clearly a lot of work has gone into #SSGB but it's ruined by the mumbling . I think this is the worst since Jamaica Inn.
